evidence_items.text: The investigation made the following findings: ● When an aeronautical radio station is licensed and approved to provide an Air Ground Communication Service, the service must be provided inside published hours of operation, unless promulgated otherwise by NOTAM or other suitable means.
● The British Gliding Association (BGA) to promulgate information on the avoidance of midair collisions.
● The respective gliding clubs to clarify their requirements for the use of radios by pilots.

children_spec.statement: Crew members were physically present and accessible during critical communication periods
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew duty logs, location tracking, and witness statements to confirm presence and accessibility during communication windows

children_spec.statement: Communication equipment was operational and available for use by the crew
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records, equipment status reports, and post-incident equipment tests to verify operational status

children_spec.statement: Communication channels were not obstructed or overloaded, allowing messages to be sent and received
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze communication logs and technical data for evidence of channel congestion, interference, or blockage

node.statement: Crew members were physically present and accessible during critical communication periods

defeaters: Evidence showing crew physical presence and accessibility during critical communication periods
Contradictory evidence indicating crew absence or inaccessibility
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items (S1, S2, S3) addresses whether crew members were physically present and accessible during critical communication periods.

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental markings were physically present at the location
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect the location for presence of required environmental markings such as signs, lights, or painted indicators; absence or damage would lower the probability

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental markings were visible and legible under the conditions at the time
children_spec.test_procedure: Evaluate visibility and legibility of markings considering lighting, weather, and obstructions; poor visibility or illegibility would lower the probability

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental markings were maintained and functioning as intended
children_spec.test_procedure: Assess maintenance records and physical condition of markings to confirm they were operational and not degraded; evidence of neglect or malfunction would lower the probability

node.statement: Relevant environmental markings were maintained and functioning as intended

defeaters: Evidence showing that environmental markings were not maintained or malfunctioning
Explicit statements confirming the status of environmental markings
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence directly or indirectly addresses whether relevant environmental markings were maintained and functioning as intended.

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components required for control were physically present and intact
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect the aircraft's mechanical control components for presence and physical integrity; absence or damage would lower the probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were accessible and not obstructed
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine if any obstruction or blockage prevented mechanical control components from functioning; presence of obstruction would lower the probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were capable of moving as intended
children_spec.test_procedure: Test the mechanical control components for free and correct movement; restricted or jammed movement would lower the probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were properly connected to the control interface
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify the mechanical linkage between control interface and components; disconnection or misalignment would lower the probability

node.statement: Mechanical control components were capable of moving as intended

defeaters: Evidence showing mechanical control components were not capable of moving as intended
Direct inspection or test results of mechanical control components
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items (S1, S2, S3) addresses the mechanical control components' capability to move as intended.

children_spec.statement: Availability of required pushback equipment at the time of operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check maintenance and inventory logs to confirm if pushback equipment was present and operational during the incident

children_spec.statement: Availability of qualified personnel to perform the pushback procedure
children_spec.test_procedure: Review crew rosters and duty logs to verify if trained personnel were present and assigned to the pushback task

children_spec.statement: Availability of clear communication channels between ground crew and flight crew during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze communication recordings and equipment status reports to determine if communication was available and functional

node.statement: Availability of qualified personnel to perform the pushback procedure

Documentation or reports confirming personnel qualifications and availability
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items addresses the availability of qualified personnel to perform the pushback procedure.

node.statement: Communication channels were not obstructed or overloaded, allowing messages to be sent and received

defeaters: Direct evidence of channel obstruction or overload
Reports or logs showing communication failures or delays

quotes.exact_quote: When an aeronautical radio station is licensed and approved to provide an Air Ground Communication Service, the service must be provided inside published hours of operation, unless promulgated otherwise by NOTAM or other suitable means.
The British Gliding Association (BGA) to promulgate information on the avoidance of midair collisions.
The respective gliding clubs to clarify their requirements for the use of radios by pilots.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence discusses regulatory and procedural aspects of communication services and radio use but does not directly address whether communication channels were obstructed or overloaded during the incident (S1, S2, S3).
